The following are indications for shock or impending shock:
•
Narrowing of pulse pressure to ≤20 mmHg.
•
Hypotension is commonly observed.
•
Some patients may present with clinical signs of shock, that is, rapid and weak pulse, delayed capillary refill time (>2 seconds), cold-clammy skin, or skin mottling with normal blood pressure.
•
Rising Hct 320% and thrombocytopenia. Leukopenia and/or thrombocytopenia, poor appetite, clinical deterioration, and significant bleeding during defervescence are all indications for hospitalization ( Kalayanarooj, 2011b).
